thread.title: Nissan Shows Off New Compact Crossover Concept
thread.title_full: Nissan Shows Off New Compact Crossover Concept

title: Nissan Shows Off New Compact Crossover Concept
text:
Nissan Shows Off New Compact Crossover Concept Sep 20, 2015 [Click to enlarge image] [Click to enlarge image] 
Nissan Motor Co Ltd showed the "Gripz Concept" compact crossover concept at Frankfurt Motor Show 2015. 
For the vehicle, the company combined the performance and practicality of a crossover and sportiness. 
As a power train, Nissan employed a series hybrid system that generates electricity with a gasoline engine and drives the vehicle with a driving motor. The Gripz Concept comes with the same motor as the "Leaf" electric vehicle (EV). The maximum output and torque of the motor are 80kW and 254NÂ·m. It does not make much noise and features a high fuel efficiency and smooth, quick acceleration. 
The Gripz Concept measures 4,100 (L) x 1,890 (W) x 1,500 (H), and its wheelbase is 2,580mm. It has two front seats and two rear seats. The front doors are gull-wing doors, and the rear doors can be opened backwards. There is no center pillar so that it is easy to get into the vehicle.
